intro: Dieffenbachia meleagris, commonly known as the "shooting star" plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, variegated, arrow-shaped leaves that often feature a mix of green, white, and pink hues. The plant belongs to the Araceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Its stems are sturdy and can grow quite tall, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. The plant is also noted for its ability to purify indoor air, contributing to its popularity as a houseplant.
